history.text: Hello, how are you?
Hello, I'm well. What's on the tab today?

Blind date movie, have 
you seen it?
Not at all, what is that? A parody?
It has Sandra Bullock and Tim Mcgraw in it
a very emotional story, she adopts a child and he ends up being really good at sports
and changes his life
Oh I thought it'd be like a quirky romantic comedy. It's more of a drama I see.
it's based on a true story called The Blind Side
Yes, usually Bulloock is in romantic comedies but this one is pretty serious and she very good
I've seen the Blind Side! How are they similar? I really like that movie
very emotional movie and worth seeing
I think this one is even better, great story line and the cast is great!
it's 2009 movie so it's definitely out there on Netflix
Well if it's better than the Blind Side (which is already an A+) I'd definitely give it a try.
Oh okay, it's a little older
I like that. That way when I watch I can check reddit for their take on it
Yes, give it a shot you won't regret it!
You've convinced me, I'm gonna look it up now!
Is it family friendly
definitely, I cried during his film, this is great to show the kids too teaches them compassion and goodness!
Great, I always like to make movies a family ordeal. How's the cinematography/quality seeing as it's a little dated?
it's actually very good quality, the director did a great job! It really feels like a modern film and you would not know the difference
Hancock directed many great films and did a great job on this one!
That's awesome. I don't want the kids complaining about me forcing them to watch some grainy old film haha!
Hopefully it's not too long. Does it excess 90 minutes?
87 minutes long and definitely not a granny film
so grab your kids and if they are 10+ years old they would enjoy it oo
too
87 minutes isn't bad at all!
Ok so I need tissues and popcorn and I'm all set for a good movie
I appreciate this thorough synopsis, it's just my taste level
you won't even notice, when you watch a good movie time flies!
That's true. One more question
Are there any inappropriate love scenes?
Nothing at all, it's all kids friendly, it's just a serious and emotional story that's why the kids need to be 10+ to understand it
Great, hopefully it gets some psychological discussion flowing afterwards
definitely, compassion, love, achievement, etc!

uid1response.feedback: I'm genuinely interested in this movie now. I was sold on it when they compared it to The Blind Side!

uid2response.feedback: Great chat and very good partner, thanks!
